clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Pain Neuroscience Education in Chronic Musculoskeletal Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Pain Neuroscience Education as Complement to Physiotherapy in Chronic Musculoskeletal Pain: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Chronic musculoskeletal pain (CMP) is highly prevalent, disabling and with high socio-economic costs, with many negative effects on quality of life. CMP affects the ability to perform work, social, recreational and domestic tasks by changing the mood and concentration of this population that suffers.
In a study carried out in 2010, 17% of the Spanish population had experienced pain in the last month and according to the severity of symptoms 12% felt severe , 64% moderate and 24% mild pain. In this same study it is specified that 61% was due to back pain, 29% due to neck pain and 23% due to shoulder pain.
Pain neuroscience education (PNE) has been shown as an effective treatment strategy in increasing knowledge and understanding of neurobiology, neurophysiology and pain processing, modifying beliefs about it, improving patient skills and encouraging to the accomplishment of physical and social activities in different chronic pathologies.

detailed_description.textblock: Study design and setting: The design of the present study will be a randomized controlled trial with 2 follow-ups (ten days and three months after intervention) that will be performed between May 2017 and June 2017 in public health system in Malaga, Spain. The outcomes will be assessed at baseline (t1), ten days after intervention (t2), and three months after intervention (t3). Written informed consent will be acquired for all participants prior to their participation. The study will be implemented and reported in line with the CONSORT statement.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline pain and function pain associated at 10 days and 3 months
primary_outcome.description: This outcome will be measured with the Graded Chronic Pain Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline central pain sensitization at 10 days and 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome will be measured with Algometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline self-efficacy at 10 days and 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome will be measured with the Self-Efficacy Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline neurophysiology of pain knowledge at after pain neuroscience education session
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome will be measured with the Revised Neurophysiology of Pain Questionnaire
This outcome will be measured with the Instrument for Measuring Patient Satisfaction

arm_group.description: Pain neuroscience education (PNE) can be defined as an educational session or sessions describing the neurobiology and neurophysiology of pain, and pain processing by the nervous system. It will be applied one time (at baseline). Physiotherapy includes kinesitherapy, electrotherapy, thermotherapy and exercises.
Physiotherapy includes kinesitherapy, electrotherapy, thermotherapy and exercises.

intervention.description: Physiotherapy cover kinesitherapy, electrotherapy, thermotherapy and exercises techniques. Besides that it will be covered the understanding and acknowledgement about how pain is processed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18-65 years
- Willing and able to participate
- Diagnosis of Chronic Musculoskeletal Pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Systemic disorders
- Medical history of severe trauma or trauma in the last 6 months
- Significant changes in pharmacological treatment
- Participating in another clinical trial
- Unable to understand spanish spoken and written
